page.title: 01LAINDON AND BASILDON NEWTOWN
page.content: {Laindon}is a neighbourhood area within {Basildon New Town.}The New Town lies 30 miles east of{London.}It was built in response to the housing shortages in London's East End, caused by{second {world war.}Demand for development also came from residents of the plotland district.{The plotlanders}had been attracted to the area at the turn of the century by cheap and unspoilt countryside. By 1940's these people were agitating for improved conditions. The{Government}designated the area as a New Town and{Basildon {Development Corporation}was formed. Today Basildon's{population is {100,000.}The main neighbourhood areas are{Laindon, Fryerns, Pitsea and {Vange.}The area is served by the {Frenchurch Street-Southend}railway line. The area has all essential services and a pleasant envirnoment.
